strategy: draft: You are an ML research agent working on a task.

actions.action:
cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.linear_model import LinearRegression
from sklearn.metrics import r2_score

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Drop rows with missing target value
train_df.dropna(subset=['SalePrice'], inplace=True)

# Fill numerical columns with median
num_cols = train_df.select_dtypes(include=['int64', 'float64']).columns
for col in num_cols:
    train_df[col].fillna(train_df[col].median(), inplace=True)
    test_df[col].fillna(train_df[col].median(), inplace=True)

# Convert categorical columns to dummy variables
cat_cols = train_df.select_dtypes(include=['object']).columns
train_df = pd.get_dummies(train_df, columns=cat_cols)
test_df = pd.get_dummies(test_df, columns=cat_cols)

# Ensure both train and test have the same features
common_cols = set(train_df.columns) & set(test_df.columns)
train_df = train_df[common_cols]
test_df = test_df[common_cols]

# Split training data into features and target
X_train = train_df.drop(columns=['SalePrice'])
y_train = train_df['SalePrice']

# Initialize and train model
model = LinearRegression()
model.fit(X_train, y_train)

# Predict on validation set
val_df = pd.read_csv('data/validation.csv')
val_X = val_df.drop(columns=['SalePrice'])
val_y = val_df['SalePrice']
val_predictions = model.predict(val_X)

# Calculate R2 score
print(f"Validation R2 score: {r2_score(val_y, val_predictions)}")

# Predict on test set
test_predictions = model.predict(test_df)

# Save predictions to submission.csv
submission = pd.DataFrame({'Id': test_df['Id'], 'SalePrice': test_predictions})
submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE
